STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
June 17, 2025
Brian E Millikin
MIDLAND/GLADWIN COUNTY DHHS
1509 WASHINGTON ST STE A, Suite A
MIDLAND, MI, 48640-5612
Re: License #: CP560201302
Dear Brian E Millikin:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
06/13/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Mark Hunter, Licensing Consultant
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the following:
CPA Rule 400.12510 Independent living agreement
• (2) The agreement must be signed and dated by
the youth and the social service worker. The
agreement must be reviewed with the youth at
least once every 90 calendar days and a copy
provided to the youth.
Three of the three current independent living youth records reviewed did not include
adequate information to determine the youth had an independent living agreement
with the agency that was signed and reviewed with the youth at least every 90 days
as required by this rule.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or provided.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or provided.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: There
was one noncompliance as a part of the renewal evaluation completed 04/30/2024
that required the submission of a CAP. The noncompliance was for a policy issue
that is no longer a part of this audit evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The last annual evaluation had one area of noncompliance identified. The Chief
Administrator Annual Assessment provided a review of the corrective action
submitted to establish compliance. The identified noncompliance was a policy
area that is no longer a part of this audit evaluation. The Chief Administrator
Annual Assessment also presented ongoing activities implemented to maintain
compliance in other rule related areas.
Financial Overview
Not Applicable
Staff and Youth Interviews
Child Welfare Staff participated in entrance and exit conferences. Staff interviews
did not identify any areas of concern.
Analyst interviews with youth did not identify any areas of concern and indicated
appropriate support services are provided.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of foster care, licensing and independent living services. All files were
stored securely and there is a cross shredder for CHRI.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There was one safety alert identified.
Safety Alert: One home needed a smoke detector.
Resolution: A smoke detector was provided and installed with picture confirmation.
3

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
06/16/2025
________________________________________
Mark Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
June 17, 2025
